info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 13 at 3:15AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Light Snow Accumulations Expected Through the Early Morning Hours... A band of light snow extended from northeast Tennessee through far southwest Virginia into eastern West Virginia or roughly from Tazewell VA to Bluefield VA to Lewisburg WV. This snow will likely persist to near daybreak before moving east of the this area. Snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches will be possible across this region by daybreak. Untreated roads and sidewalks will become slick and hazardous as temperatures fall into the mid and upper 20s. Although these snow accumulations fall short of typical Winter Weather Advisory levels, travel across this region this morning is discouraged. If you must travel through the morning hours today, reduce speed and drive slower than normal, allow extra time to reach your destination, leave extra distance between you and the vehicle in front of you. Avoid sudden breaking and accelerating and use extreme caution while traveling in more mountainous terrain. If conditions become worse than expected at this time, a Winter Weather Advisory may be needed for part or all of this area. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or visit our web site at www.weather.gov/blacksburg for further weather information.
